meanings.definition: To take air into the lungs and then expel it
meanings.sent2: The baby breathed in the fresh air at the park.
meanings.sent3: The tree breathed out a sigh of relief as the storm passed.
meanings.sent4: The city breathed in the energy of the bustling streets.
meanings.sent5: The athlete breathed deeply before the race, preparing for the challenge ahead.

meanings.sent1: He breathed the words 'I love you' softly in her ear.
meanings.sent2: The actor breathed his lines with passion on stage.
meanings.sent3: The teacher breathed the answer to the student's question.
meanings.sent4: His speech breathed life into the dull meeting.
meanings.sent5: She breathed out the secret, unable to keep it to herself any longer.

meanings.sent1: Every living creature has breathed at some point.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins breathed with history and stories of the past.
meanings.sent3: The old house seemed to breathe with a life of its own.
meanings.sent4: The forest breathed a sense of tranquility and peace.
meanings.sent5: In the silence of the night, the town breathed softly, a gentle hum of existence.
